page.title: 17HOUSING IN BERKHAMSTED
page.content: Some of the houses in the town pre-date 1500 A.D. From a survey of 226 pupils' homes we found that 21% were built before 1918, 18% between 1919 and 1944, 33% between 1945 and 1970 and 28% have been built since 1970. 50% of these homes are detached, 32% are semi-detached and 18% are terraced. 85% of homes are conventional two floor dwellings and 25% of all homes do not have fire places due to central heating. 37% of homes had 3 bedrooms, 43% had 4, while 15% had 5 or more bedrooms.(The other 5% had less than 3.)54% of owners felt they live in the town, while 46% felt that they live close to the country- side. 89% of gardens are either medium sized, or large and 69% have a garage. 98% of our homes were built of tradi- tional bricks and mortar. The average distance from a shop is 6.6 minutes.
